message: انا عايزة اعمل android app يكون زى firewall علشان يعمل block لبعض apps من انها تستخدم الانترنت لما عملت سيرش لقيت انه علشان اعمل كده هعمل root لل device علشان اخلى الابليكشن يتحكم فى الجزئية دى او فى طريقة تانية عن طريق انى استخدم vpn service فسألى هل الكلام ده صح و لا و لو صح حد عنده tutorial او research يخص الموضوع ده و شكرا مقدما

data.message:
In Android, every app is run in its own sandbox, it has no direct effect  on other apps.

The sandbox forces you to use the permissions available in the Android framework, and none of these allow the functionality you just described.

So yes, you'll need to root the device first to implement something like that.

I don't have any android development experience, But there are non-root VPN based Ad-blockers, In theory you can create a similar in-concept ad-blocker where you can block all the preferred apps domains.

https://github.com/adblockplus/adblockplusandroid
Check how AdBlock+ works on Android without root, you'll have to know JNI though to understand how this code works.
في حاجة اسمها device administrator ممكن الابليكيشن بتاعك يبقى كدة ويبقى له تحكم في حاجة زي دي..
فيه ناس في جامعة حلون ده مشروع تخرجهم 😀

Read the app description and the Permession request, you may have an idea about creating a similar App :
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.yirgalab.dzzz&hl=en

شوفى النقاش الى هنا 
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/27107192/is-tcp-packet-filtering-possible-on-mobile-platforms
وابدأى من هنا بقى 
https://developer.android.com/reference/android/net/VpnService.html

no root fire wall, search it on Google Play
